author: peter.davies
content: If I send a transaction to a contract that I counterfactually know about, but that hasn't been deployed, the EVM will treat my transaction as a transfer (even though it has a payload) and send my ether to the uncreated contract address (presumably losing my ether). Is this correct or does something more complicated happen?

author: sky.cactus
content: That is correct.

author: schone_wizard
content: Do all the ‚Äúnot ready‚Äù nodes on Ethernodes stats pose a problem for the hard fork taking place on time?

author: schone_wizard
content: https://ethernodes.org/london

author: sky.cactus
content: No.

author: sky.cactus
content: Those nodes will just fork away like happens every hard fork.

author: schone_wizard
content: Great good to know üôÇ

author: timhc22
content: hey, is there any information anywhere on which other 3 EIPs are part of the London upgrade? (as well as 1559 and 3554)

author: timhc22
content: oh  I found it: https://beincrypto.com/ethereum-london-hard-fork-heres-what-you-need-to-know/

author: bru9
content:
1559(fee market change)
3198(BASEFEE opcode)
3529(reduction in refunds)
3541(reject contracts starting with 0xef)
3554(diff bomb delay)

author: sky.cactus
content: https://github.com/ethereum/eth1.0-specs/blob/master/network-upgrades/mainnet-upgrades/london.md

author: timhc22
content:
amazing, thanks Micah and <@!395931070689837056> 

I'll need to read a bit more around the other 3, eip1559 and 3554 are the ones everyone know about, but I'm doing a Q&A event tomorrow, so I'll need to give a brief overview of the other 3 as well

author: timhc22
content: is the 0xEF byte a bit like a BOM mark?

author: sky.cactus
content: Kinda.

author: sky.cactus
content: It is reserving a byte so that we can do contract versioning.

author: timhc22
content: oh sweet

author: timhc22
content: so the 3541 proposal just makes versiong easier

author: sky.cactus
content: Well, EVM versioning for contracts would perhaps be a slightly more correct statement.

author: sky.cactus
content: Makes it so we can make significant EVM changes without breaking everything.

author: sky.cactus
content: There is a livestream call happening right now that is going over all of the EIPs if you prefer to tune in <@597792256837156971>.

author: timhc22
content: yes please, do you have a link?

author: sky.cactus
content: https://youtu.be/nWAZmFVpCv8

author: timhc22
content: thanks dude

author: 0xmaka
content:
Just been looking in to how a transaction might have been mined, when balance does not appear to have existed.
Wondering if anyone understands this better than I do.
Looks like arbitrage swap, but it's 120 eth, on a $10k pool. Fee's are never applied to the pool, because they don't exist. But how is this even mined, would love to better understand what I'm looking at.
https://etherscan.io/tx/0xe18e3d3824b435958a78ff03abbc7a368fe2b89af5be6ba30322f5c797d71a40

Looks like gasless relays and self destructs for destination address.
Don't really get it, would enjoy some schoolin' on this one.
